title: URIError
markdown:
# URIError

The **`URIError`** object represents an error when a global URI handling function was used in a wrong way.

`URIError` is a [serializable object](/en-US/docs/Glossary/Serializable%5Fobject), so it can be cloned with [structuredClone()](/en-US/docs/Web/API/structuredClone) or copied between [Workers](/en-US/docs/Web/API/Worker) using [postMessage()](/en-US/docs/Web/API/Worker/postMessage "postMessage()").

`URIError` is a subclass of [Error](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Error).

## [Constructor](#constructor)

[URIError()](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/URIError/URIError)

Creates a new `URIError` object.

## [Instance properties](#instance%5Fproperties)

_Also inherits instance properties from its parent [Error](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Error)_.

These properties are defined on `URIError.prototype` and shared by all `URIError` instances.

[URIError.prototype.constructor](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Object/constructor)

The constructor function that created the instance object. For `URIError` instances, the initial value is the [URIError](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/URIError/URIError) constructor.

[URIError.prototype.name](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Error/name)

Represents the name for the type of error. For `URIError.prototype.name`, the initial value is `"URIError"`.

## [Instance methods](#instance%5Fmethods)

_Inherits instance methods from its parent [Error](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Error)_.

## [Examples](#examples)

### [Catching an URIError](#catching%5Fan%5Furierror)

```
try {
  decodeURIComponent("%");
} catch (e) {
  console.log(e instanceof URIError); // true
  console.log(e.message); // "malformed URI sequence"
  console.log(e.name); // "URIError"
  console.log(e.fileName); // "Scratchpad/1"
  console.log(e.lineNumber); // 2
  console.log(e.columnNumber); // 2
  console.log(e.stack); // "@Scratchpad/2:2:3\n"
}

```

### [Creating an URIError](#creating%5Fan%5Furierror)

```
try {
  throw new URIError("Hello", "someFile.js", 10);
} catch (e) {
  console.log(e instanceof URIError); // true
  console.log(e.message); // "Hello"
  console.log(e.name); // "URIError"
  console.log(e.fileName); // "someFile.js"
  console.log(e.lineNumber); // 10
  console.log(e.columnNumber); // 0
  console.log(e.stack); // "@Scratchpad/2:2:9\n"
}

```

## [Specifications](#specifications)

| Specification                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [ECMAScript Language Specification  \# sec-native-error-types-used-in-this-standard-urierror](https://tc39.es/ecma262/multipage/fundamental-objects.html#sec-native-error-types-used-in-this-standard-urierror) |

BCD tables only load in the browser
